Tod Westcott

Unholy Medicine

When billions in profits are at stake, people lie to get them. That’s what biotech firm Gentra and a partnering research hospital did.

Gentra hoped it had a new cancer cure. The initial trial reaped a batch of complete remissions. Ecstatic, Gentra prepared to market their chemotherapy treatment nationwide, at a cool half million per treatment.

But Dr. Timothy Carrol, the oncologist overseeing the trial, discovered Gentra's chemo had not caused the miraculous cures. The cures happened through an attending nurse, Nurse Rosemary, who prayed with patients who asked her to join them in healing prayer.

When Gentra's hospital partner learned about Nurse Rosemary, they fired her. They couldn’t risk a Bible believing nurse receiving credit for cures they attributed to the chemo protocol.

As a lifelong atheist, Dr. Carrol’s instinct was to take the hospital’s side. In material terms, he had everything he could want. A glamorous wife. A palatial home backed up to the city’s most prestigious golf course. A five-car garage filled with luxury automobiles. The approval of his world-renowned heart-surgeon father.

His riches would rocket if he kept his mouth shut and went along with the lie that Gentra's chemo caused the cancer cures. So, at first, he did not come to Nurse Rosemary’s defense.

But one horrifying night in the emergency room, Jesus appeared before Dr. Carrol and opened his eyes. He saw that demonic powers caused many diseases. And, in that moment, Jesus gave Dr. Carrol the gift of healing. On the spot, he healed a cancer patient by laying on hands and calling on the name of Jesus.

Dr. Carrol was forever changed. A change that cost him everything. But what he lost in the worldly realm, he gained in the spiritual realm. He teamed up with Nurse Rosemary and prayer warrior Pastor Jacob. With them, he learned the truth of what Paul wrote: “Our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, authorities, powers, and spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.”

Unholy University

What would you do if you were a professor of evolution and Jesus showed you the truth of God’s creation? That’s what happened to Professor Ryan Wood in a near death experience. He was awestruck.

Before Jesus' intervention, Professor Wood was a hard core atheist. He abused his teaching position to obliterate belief in Jesus Christ. His best-selling books on atheism won him guest appearances on cable news and TV morning shows. But after Jesus appeared to him, he was eager to reveal the truth. As a renowned scientist, Professor Wood was used to the public treating his words as gospel. He expected his revelation that God is the creator of life to be received as breaking news. He was so wrong.

The networks banned him from future appearances. The students who flocked to his classes mocked him and walked out. His university schemed to defraud him of his tenure and run him off campus.

Ryan Wood would not slip away without a fight. Jesus also showed him that his aggressive atheism handed unwary students over to the soul-destroying evils of Satan. He was desperate to win those souls back for Jesus, and to break the university’s cancel-Christ agenda dictating the university curriculum.

But he could not win the battle alone. He found a surprise ally in Elizabeth Williams, a courageous, believing student. The two together exposed a system that would resort to murder to keep its grip on power.

Unholy University is a true-to-life novel revealing how the university attacks and suppresses Christian belief.

Jesus Christ is real. He walked this earth 2000 years ago. He was crucified. He was raised with mighty power from the dead by God the Father. He is eternally alive today. He is waiting for you to join him in the glory of God's creation. Jesus is the pinnacle of the creation: King of kings; Lord of lords. By opening your heart in love to him, he relates to you as your eternally loving brother. You bring yourself into the truth of what this creation we live in is all about. And your greatest adventure begins.
